messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] George Bernard Shaw quote
messages.msgSnippet: My schooling not only failed to teach me what it professed to be  teaching, but prevented me from being educated to an extent which  infuriates me when I
messages.messageBody:
"My schooling not only failed to teach me what it
professed to be 
teaching, but prevented me from being educated to an
extent which 
infuriates me when I think of all I might have learned
at home by 
myself."

- George Bernard Shaw

Was listening to an old LP today (yes, we still have
vinyl :-) ) and one of the lines was:
'And I curse the teachers, with all of their reading
What we needed most can't be found in those books.'

One Golden Rule, by Chris Rea, from Shamrock Diaries

Tracy

messages.subject: George Bernard Shaw quote
messages.msgSnippet: My schooling not only failed to teach me what it professed to be teaching, but prevented me from being educated to an extent which infuriates me when I think
messages.messageBody:
"My schooling not only failed to teach me what it professed to be
teaching, but prevented me from being educated to an extent which
infuriates me when I think of all I might have learned at home by
myself."

- George Bernard Shaw
